ul.li: There are nodes synchronized on ENM.
The ENM user must have read rights for Topology Browser.

context.p: When Topology Browser is accessed from the Launcher page, the full topology tree is shown by default. The user can browse and locate a Managed Object through either the top level SubNetworks or the 'All Other Nodes' branch. In order to view the associated Network Element of an MeContext or ManagedElement, the user must locate and return the object through Network Explorer. An example of this process is given in this tutorial.

ul.li: Open the Topology Browser page and select an MeContext Managed Object from the tree.
After noting the objects name, click the Search for an Object link from the Action Bar.
Enter 'NetworkElement' into the Network Explorer input box.
Click the Search button and wait for results.

A table with a list of Network Elements will display. Click the checkbox of the Network Element associated with the Managed Object from step 1 above. To return to the Topology Browser page click the 'Locate in Topology' button in the Action Bar and Topology Browser will open in a new browser window (enable popups in the browser if required). Alternatively, it is also possible to select the 'Return Selected Managed Object' button located on the bottom bar, which will return to the App which called Network Explorer (in this case, Topology Browser).

When the Topology Browser page opens, it is possible to view the Network Element associated with the MO on the Topology Tree. The Topology Tree will not show the Full Network Tree when displaying Network Elements, as they are located on opposite sides of the ENM Base Model.
